result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randall John Vanderbeek

defendant.name: Vanderbeek, Randall John
defendant.address: 8191 Custer Trail, Inver Grove Heights, MN 55076

records.addlTxt: $500.00 bond on file moved to case 21CF568.

2:54 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Benoy     INCLUDES: 21CF568, 21CF738 & 22CF11   Defendant Randall John Vanderbeek in court.  Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore in court for Randall John Vanderbeek.  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin.    ADA Ballo makes reference to 22CF634 - Court calls case.  Atty Ballo states that an amended Information has been filed in 21CF568. Recites agreement.  Amended information has not been received by the Court. Recess: 3:07   Case recalled:  3:11  Amended information provided to Court and Atty Larimore.  Court reviews amended information.  Atty Ballo states in Court 3 - use of dangerous weapon will be dropped.  2nd Amended information will be filed.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Amended Ct 1, 2 & 3 in 21CF568.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Amended Cts 1, 2 & 3 in 21CF568. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses and reads in 21CF738. 22CF111 & 22CF634.  Court QUASHES warrant in 22CF634. Sentencing arguments. Statement by DE.  Crt orders: 

S/W:
2 years probation w/ conditions
- no contact with A P
- no contact with D D
- no contact with R S 
- anger management classes
- domestic abuse assessment
-  programming as deemed appropriate by agent
-  90 days conditional jail - STAYED
- court costs
-  DNA surcharge
- costs paid through probation
-  jail credit reserved.
Final pre-trial on October 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Scheduling Order. Signed by RMW on 6/29/2022. c: DA and Atty via e-file. km

9:07 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: B Harris, Defendant Randall John Vanderbeek in court, in custody.  Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore in court for Randall John Vanderbeek.  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Includes 21CF568, 21CF641, 21CF738, 22CF111.  Atty Larimore requesting to set for trial, states an offer has been made but not willing to accept it at this time. Court sets trial on 21CF568, 21CF738, 22CF111.  File 21CF641 is scheduled for sentencing hearing.  9/28/22 pretrial submissions due. Bond continues in open files.  Adjourned at 9:26 AM. bph
Jury trial - 12 person on October 24, 2022 at 08:00 am.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 21CF641 (FPT), 21CF568, 21CF738 & 22CF111 (PTC):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY:  Joel Kenneth Larimore appears via zoom  DF:  Randall John Vanderbeek appeared. Cases called at 8:51 a.m. Court notes 21CF641 is scheduled for final pre trial with jury trial scheduled for 06/06/22. Atty Larimore states there is no resolution. Trial to remain. Court reviews file. Nothing further to address by either party. Court notes no witness list has been filed by either side. State will file their witness list right away. Atty Larimore is not planning on calling any witnesses. Address and phone confirmed.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 21CF568, 21CF641, 21CF738 & 22CF111 (FPT):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow   DF ATTY:  Joel Kenneth Larimore   DF:  Randall John Vanderbeek appeared. Case called at 2:38 p.m. Court notes these matters are scheduled for final pre trial and jury trial. Atty Larimore states matters are unresolved. ADA Rockow states there was a request filed by the State for a continuance on the 21CF568 file. One of the witnesses is unavailable. Court notes 21CF641 is scheduled to back that file up. Will move that file to number one position then. ADA Ballo is now present at 2:41 p.m. Court will grant the continuance request and schedule 21CF641 for that date. Court notes will not accept a settlement after today's date.
By self - 22R 005394
Filed by ADA Ballo. km             to ty

TO ALSO INCLUDE 21CF568 & 21CF641 (ARGN), 21CF738 & 22CF111 (STC):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Joel Kenneth Larimore   DF:  Randall John Vanderbeek appeared from jail. Case called at 3:30 p.m. Court notes 21CF568 & 21CF641 are scheduled for arraignment. Atty Larimore has reviewed information with client. He understands charges and penalties. Waives further reading. Enters NG plea to all counts in both files. Requesting a speedy trial. Court schedules.  Jury trial scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Filed by DA Anderson. km
Filed by ADA Ballo. km

Status conference on March 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF111 (PH), 21CF568, 21CF641 & 21CF738 (PTC):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Joel Kenneth Larimore   DF:  Randall John Vanderbeek appeared from jail. Case called at 4:07 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a preliminary hearing. Atty Larimore requesting testimony. ADA Becker calls Deputy Gostovich to the Stand. S/T Scott Gostovich. Employed with the St Croix County Sheriff's Department. Direct by ADA Becker. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Cross by Atty Larimore. Witness excused. ADA Becker requesting Court take judicial notice of bonds in St Croix County files 21CF568, 21CF641 & 21CF738. ADA Becker requesting bind over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Larimore requesting arraignment today. ADA Becker will file information to mirror complaint. Atty Larimore enters NG plea and makes a speedy trial demand on all files. Court schedules. ADA Becker notes preliminary hearing has not been held in 21CF568 & 21CF641. Court schedules. On 21CF568 & 21CF641, DE will waive preliminary hearing. Court reviews rights with DE to preliminary hearing. DE understands and waives right to preliminary hearing. Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial on both 21CF568 & 21CF641. ADA Becker requesting arraignment be scheduled out on those two files. Court schedules. Court adjourned at 4:26 p.m.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
filed by DA's Office.  ala
Preliminary hearing on February 28, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Amanda P.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Holly Elkin Rockow   DF ATTY:  Joel Kenneth Larimore   DF:  Randall John Vanderbeek appeared from jail via video. Case called at 1:10 p.m. DE has a copy of complaint. Atty Larimore was unaware of new charges. Provided copy of complaint. ADA Rockow requesting cash. Court schedules for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
